title: C.I.A. Conducted Drone Strike on Port in Venezuela
summary: The attack last week, on a dock purportedly used for shipping narcotics, did not kill anyone, people briefed on the operation said. But it was the first known U.S. operation inside Venezuela.

title: How Russia and Ukraine Are Fighting to Shape Trump’s View of the War
summary: Off the battlefield, each side is trying to influence President Trump’s perception of the military conflict as they look to negotiate a peace settlement in their favor.

title: Trump Upended the Federal Government. The Full Scope of the Impact Is Still Unclear.
summary: President Trump achieved his goal of shrinking the work force. But many current and former officials say the government is less dependable and efficient than it was a year ago.

title: New Year’s Eve Concerts at Kennedy Center Are Canceled
summary: The jazz drummer Billy Hart said the decision was “evidently” connected to President Trump’s name being added to the arts center.

title: Cheap Solar Is Transforming Lives and Economies Across Africa
summary: Chinese panels are now so affordable that businesses and families are snapping them up, slashing their bills and challenging utilities.

title: Gone in 2025: A Yearlong Procession of Giants
summary: Marquee names all, they found international fame in the arts, politics, the sciences and beyond.

title: Protests Over Iran’s Currency Crash and Inflation Spread to Universities
summary: Iranian leaders face pressure over a currency collapse and threats of possible military strikes from Israel and the United States over Tehran’s nuclear activities.

title: Saudis Say Airstrike in Yemen Targeted Arms From U.A.E.
summary: Saudi-led forces struck an Emirati shipment early Tuesday, worsening tensions between the once-close allies. The Saudis said the shipment had arms for a separatist group, which the Emiratis denied.

title: The Cover-Up: Inside the Plot to Conceal Assad’s Crimes
summary: Thousands of documents and interviews with Assad-era officials reveal how the regime worked to conceal evidence of its atrocities during the Syrian civil war.

title: How the Assad Regime Covered Up Its Crimes: Key Takeaways
summary: We documented how the dictator Bashar al-Assad and his henchmen conspired to hide evidence of torture and deaths of detainees during Syria’s long civil war.

title: She Tried to Kill a President. He Loved Her Anyway.
summary: A retired widower married Sara Jane Moore, who shot at President Ford in 1975. It tore his family apart.

title: Katherine Maher of NPR Has Come Out on Top Despite Battles With Trump and the CPB
summary: Katherine Maher has taken an unyielding approach to NPR’s biggest battles — which has sometimes put her at odds with her colleagues in public media.

title: Death at a Mississippi Jail: Brutal Beating or a Fall From Bed?
summary: An inmate says that no one wanted to listen when he tried repeatedly to confess to a crime at a facility known for violence.

title: Cornelius Eady to Recite Poem at Mamdani’s Inauguration
summary: Cornelius Eady, a National Book Award finalist, shared an excerpt from “Proof,” an original poem he has written for Zohran Mamdani’s inauguration as mayor of New York City.

title: Mamdani Promised Universal Child Care. How Long Could It Take?
summary: Here is what to expect if you’re expecting relief from the soaring cost of day care in New York City.

title: Carmen de Lavallade, Dancer Whose Career Spanned the Arts, Dies at 94
summary: Over six decades she worked in theater, opera, film and television alongside luminaries like Alvin Ailey, Lena Horne, Agnes de Mille and Harry Belafonte.

title: When the Best New Year’s Plans Are No New Year’s Plans
summary: Many opt out of the revelry, either as their own time-honored tradition or because of a different outlook this year.

title: How America Loses Vaccine Access
summary: America could all but lose vaccine access. Here’s how.

title: Can a Corporation Be Complicit in War Crimes? Sweden Is Trying to Find Out.
summary: It’s Sweden’s longest criminal trial. I was there because of a different historic distinction.

title: Overlooked Stories
summary: We look at some of our best stories from 2025 that Times editors thought deserved more attention.

title: George and Amal Clooney Become French Citizens
summary: Mr. Clooney, who owns a farmhouse in France, has said that living there enabled him and his wife, a human rights lawyer, to pursue a quieter existence with their children.

title: PostNord, Denmark’s Main Postal Carrier, Ends Letter Delivery
summary: PostNord, the country’s longtime service, is delivering its last letters. Few Danes send snail mail anymore, but some are mourning the end of an era.

title: Eurostar Trains Face Day of Delays After Power Failure
summary: The high-speed service between Britain and continental Europe was paralyzed during one of the busiest travel weeks of the year because of a power outage in the Channel Tunnel.

title: More Rain Forecast for Los Angeles Starting on New Year’s Eve
summary: After Christmas-week storms, two rounds of rainfall starting on New Year’s Eve could cause more flooding and mudslides.
